title: Posterior Contraction Rates for Mat\'ern Gaussian Processes on Riemannian Manifolds. (arXiv:2309.10918v1 [stat.ML])
abstract: Gaussian processes are used in many machine learning applications that rely on uncertainty quantification. Recently, computational tools for working with these models in geometric settings, such as when inputs lie on a Riemannian manifold, have been developed. This raises the question: can these intrinsic models be shown theoretically to lead to better performance, compared to simply embedding all relevant quantities into $\mathbb{R}^d$ and using the restriction of an ordinary Euclidean Gaussian process? To study this, we prove optimal contraction rates for intrinsic Mat\'ern Gaussian processes defined on compact Riemannian manifolds. translated_title: Riemannian流形上Matern高斯过程的后验收缩速率
translated_abstract: 高斯过程在许多依赖于不确定性量化的机器学习应用中被使用。最近，已经开发了在几何设置下处理这些模型的计算工具，例如，当输入位于Riemannian流形上时。这引出了一个问题：这些内在模型在理论上是否可以证明相比于将所有相关量嵌入到$\mathbb{R}^d$并使用普通欧几里德高斯过程的限制，可以带来更好的性能？为了研究这个问题，我们证明了定义在紧致Riemannian流形上的内在Matern高斯过程的最优收缩速率。我们还通过流形和环境Sobolev空间之间的迹和扩展定理证明了外在过程的类似速率：令人惊讶的是，所得到的速率与内在过程的速率相符，前提是它们的平滑参数适当匹配。我们在一些实证数据上进行了对这些速率的演示。
tldr: 该论文研究了定义在紧致Riemannian流形上的内在Matern高斯过程和外在过程之间的收缩速率，并发现它们的速率在适当匹配平滑参数的情况下是相等的。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the contraction rates between intrinsic Matern Gaussian processes defined on compact Riemannian manifolds and extrinsic processes, and finds that their rates are equal when the smoothness parameters are appropriately matched.
